mechanics.condition: Target is a creature of your choice within range AND can hear you
mechanics.outcome: Target makes a Wisdom Saving Throw

mechanics.trigger: Wisdom Saving Throw against Enthrall initiated
mechanics.condition: Target is immune to the Charmed condition
mechanics.outcome: Target automatically succeeds on the saving throw

mechanics.trigger: Wisdom Saving Throw against Enthrall initiated
mechanics.condition: Caster or caster's companions are fighting the target
mechanics.outcome: Target has advantage on the saving throw

mechanics.trigger: Target fails Wisdom Saving Throw against Enthrall
mechanics.outcome: Target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive any creature other than the caster

mechanics.trigger: Ongoing effect of Enthrall on a target
mechanics.condition: Target can no longer hear the caster
mechanics.outcome: The disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks ends for that target

description_text: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you to make a wisdom saving throw. Any creature that can't be charmed succeeds on this saving throw automatically, and if you or your companions are fighting a creature, it has advantage on the save. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive any creature other than you until the spell ends or until the target can no longer hear you. The spell ends if you are incapacitated or can no longer speak.
